newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Pacific Ports allotment option exercised.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Ports allotment option exercised.

text.p: Fairyoung Holdings Ltd's port operating arm Pacific Ports Co Ltd said on Friday it has issued an additional 30 million new shares at HK$3.09 each to cover over-allotment.
The company said Peregrine Capital Ltd, the global coordinator of its issue, had exercised an option to require the company to issue the additional new shares.
Pacific Port initially offered 160 million shares to institutional and professional investors and 40 million shares to the Hong Kong public in an initial public offering (IPO).
The public portion of the offer was 141 times subscribed.

The company then allocated 20 million shares from the international placement to the Hong Kong IPO portion. It also granted underwriters an over-allotment option to require the issue of up to 30 million new shares.
Dealing in the company shares is due to begin on Friday.
